Class: Fireadmin

Fireadmin

new Fireadmin(url)

Creates a Fireadmin object

Parameters:
Name Type Description
url String

Url of Firebase to use with Fireadmin
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 5
Example
//Create new Fireadmin Object
var fa = new Fireadmin("https://<your-app>.firebaseio.com");

Methods

accountByEmail(email, successCb, errorCb)

Get user account that is associated to a given email.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
email String

Email of account to retreive
successCb function

Function that returns account info once it is loaded
errorCb Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 178
Example
fa.accountByEmail("test@test.com", function(account){
  console.log('Account loaded:' + account);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error getting account by email:', err);
});

accountByUid(uid, successCb, errorCb)

Get account for a user given their uid.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
uid String

Unique Id for account
successCb function

Function that returns account info once it is loaded
errorCb Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error fa.accountByUid('simplelogin:1', function(account){ console.log('Account for user with uid: ' + uid + ' is : ', account); }, function(err){ console.error('Error getting account for ' + uid + ' : ', err); });
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 157

createObject(listName, objectData, onComplete)

Creates an object provided the name of the list the object will go into and the object itself. The object is created with a createdAt parameter that is a server timestamp from Firebase. If a user is currently signed in, the object will contain the author's $uid under the author parameter. This is used for the getListByAuthor function.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listName String

The name of the list the object will be put into.
objectData Object

Data you wish to be contained within new object
onComplete Fireadmin~createObjectCb

Function that runs when your object has been created successfully
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 43
Example
//creates new message object in message list
fa.createObject('messages', {title:Example, content:"Cool Message"}, function(newMsgRef){
 console.log('New Message created successfuly');
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error creating new message:', err);
});

emailAuth(loginData, successCb, errorCb)

Modified version of Firebase's authWithPassword that handles presence

Parameters:
Name Type Description
loginData object

Login data of new user
successCb function

Function that runs when the user is successfully authenticated with presence enabled.
errorCb Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 70
Example
// Signin User with email and password
fb.emailAuth({email:test@test.com, password:'testtest'}, function(auth){
 console.log('Login Successful for user:', auth.uid);
}, function(err){
 console.error('Error logging in:', err);
});

fbRef(path)

Get a firebase reference for a path in array | string form

Parameters:
Name Type Description
path String | Array

relative path to the root folder in Firebase instance
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 245
Returns:

A Firebase instance

Example
//Array as path
var userRef = fa.fbRef(['users', uid]);

objectCount(listPath, onComplete, onError)

Get count of objects in a given list

Parameters:
Name Type Description
listPath string | Array

The name or path of the list of which to count.
onComplete function

Function that runs on completion of gathering list count.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 102
Example
//String list name
fa.objectCount("users", function(count){
 console.log('There are ' + count + ' users');
});
//Array list path
fa.objectCount(['messages', messageId, 'comments'], function(commentCount){
 console.log('There are ' + commentCount + ' comments on the message with id: ' + messageId);
});

onlineUserCount(successCb, errorCb)

Get user the number of users that are currently online.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
successCb function

Function that returns number of users currently online
errorCb Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 137
Example
fa.onlineUserCount(function(count){
  console.log('There are ' + count + ' users currently online.');
});

setupPresence(uid)

Start presence management for a specificed user uid. This function is used within Fireadmin login functions.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
uid string

Unique Id for user that presence is being setup for
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 197

userCount(onComplete, onError)

Get total user count

Parameters:
Name Type Description
onComplete function

Function that returns total user count.
onError Fireadmin~errorCb

Function that runs if there is an error.
Source:
  • fireadmin.js, line 120
Example
fa.userCount("users", function(count){
 console.log('There are is a total of ' + count + ' users.');
});
